required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Efficacy and Safety of Symbicort® as an add-on Treatment to Spiriva® in Patients With Severe COPD.
clinical_study.official_title: A 12-week, Double-blind, Randomised, Parallel Group, Multi-centre, Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Budesonide/Formoterol (Symbicort Turbuhaler®) 320/9 µg One Inhalation Twice Daily on Top of Tiotropium (Spiriva®) 18 µg One Inhalation Once Daily

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of combined treatment with Symbicort and Spiriva, in terms of improvement of lung function, symptoms and inflammatory markers, in patients with severe COPD.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) Pre-dose
primary_outcome.description: Change in the pre-dose FEV1from baseline to week 12 (calculated as a mean using all available data of treatment period between week 1 and week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) 5 Min Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the 5 min post-dose FEV1from baseline to week 12 (calculated as a mean using all available data of treatment period between week 1 and week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) 60 Min Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Change in the 60 min post-dose FEV1from baseline to week 12 (calculated as a mean using all available data of treatment period between week 1 and week 12)
Change in the pre-dose FVC from baseline to week 12 (calculated as a mean using all available data of treatment period between week 1 and week 12)
Change in the 5 min post-dose FVC from baseline to week 12 (calculated as a mean using all available data of treatment period between week 1 and week 12)
Change in the 60 min post-dose FVC from baseline to week 12 (calculated as a mean using all available data of treatment period between week 1 and week 12
Change in the pre-dose IC from baseline to week 12 (calculated as a mean using all available data of treatment period between week 1 and week 12)
Change in the 60 min post-dose IC from baseline to week 12 (calculated as a mean using all available data of treatment period between week 1 and week 12)

secondary_outcome.measure: St George's Respiratory Questionnaire for COPD Patients (SGRQ-C) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change in total score from baseline (Visit 3) to end of treatment (Visit 6, or last available visit). SGRQ-C is a health related quality of life questionnaire consisting of 40 items divided into two components: 1) symptoms, 2) activity& impacts. The lowest possible value is zero and the highest 100. Higher values correspond to greater impairment in quality of life.
Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period
Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Morning Peak Expiratory Flow (PEF) 5 Min Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Morning Peak Expiratory Flow (PEF) 15 Min Post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period
Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period
Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period
Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period
Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Chest Symptoms Questionnaire (GCSQ) Score, Pre-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. The GCSQ consisted of two questions that required the patient to rate shortness of breath and feelings of chest tightness. The patients recorded their response on a five-point Likert-type scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely), the total score being calculated as the average score of the two questions.

Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. The GCSQ consisted of two questions that required the patient to rate shortness of breath and feelings of chest tightness. The patients recorded their response on a five-point Likert-type scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely), the total score being calculated as the average score of the two questions.

Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. The GCSQ consisted of two questions that required the patient to rate shortness of breath and feelings of chest tightness. The patients recorded their response on a five-point Likert-type scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely), the total score being calculated as the average score of the two questions.

secondary_outcome.measure: Capacity of Day Living in the Morning (CDLM) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. The CDLM questionnaire is as a questionnaire to report on patient's ability to carry out each of six different morning activities (score ranging from 0 "not performed" to 1"performed") and rank the difficulty of performing each of those activities (score ranging from 0 "so difficult that the activity could not be carried out by the patient on their own" to 5 "activity was not at all difficult to carry out". Total score for each morning activity range from 0-6. Total score for whole CDLM questionnaire range from 0-36.
Daily diary record - Night, after evening measurement till morning. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period
Daily diary record - Morning, after morning measurement till midday. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period
Daily diary record - Day, after morning measurement till evening. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period
Daily diary record - Total, 24 hours, during the night, and during the day. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period
Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. Symptom scale 0 - 4 (0) None (1) Mild (2) Moderate (3) Marked (4) Severe
Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. Symptom scale 0 - 4 (0) None (1) Mild (2) Moderate (3) Marked (4) Severe
Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. Symptom scale 0 - 4 (0) None (1) Mild (2) Moderate (3) Marked (4) Severe
Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. Symptom scale 0 - 4 (0) None (1) Mild (2) Moderate (3) Marked (4) Severe
Patients with worsening of COPD leading to treatment with systemic steroids (oral or parenteral), emergency room treatment or hospitalisation
Ratio of treatment period mean to run-in value
Ratio of treatment period mean to run-in value

arm_group.description: Symbicort Turbuhaler® (budesonide/formoterol) 320/9 mcg, one inhalation twice daily and Spiriva® (tiotropium) 18 mcg, one inhalation once daily
Spiriva® (tiotropium) 18 mcg, one inhalation once daily and placebo Turbuhaler one inhalation once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >=40 years of age, diagnosed COPD with symptoms >=2 years, pre-bronchodilatory FEV1 <=50% of PN
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current respiratory tract disorder other than COPD, history of asthma or rhinitis, significant or unstable cardiovascular disorder

outcome.title: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV1) Pre-dose
outcome.description: Change in the pre-dose FEV1from baseline to week 12 (calculated as a mean using all available data of treatment period between week 1 and week 12)
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) was performed and was based on data from all subjects who were randomized, took at least 1 dose of study medication, and contributed sufficient data for calculation of this outcome Measure.

outcome.title: St George's Respiratory Questionnaire for COPD Patients (SGRQ-C) Score
outcome.description: Change in total score from baseline (Visit 3) to end of treatment (Visit 6, or last available visit). SGRQ-C is a health related quality of life questionnaire consisting of 40 items divided into two components: 1) symptoms, 2) activity& impacts. The lowest possible value is zero and the highest 100. Higher values correspond to greater impairment in quality of life.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) was performed and was based on data from all subjects who were randomized, took at least 1 dose of study medication, and contributed sufficient data for calculation of this outcome Measure.

outcome.description: Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. The GCSQ consisted of two questions that required the patient to rate shortness of breath and feelings of chest tightness. The patients recorded their response on a five-point Likert-type scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely), the total score being calculated as the average score of the two questions.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) was performed and was based on data from all subjects who were randomized, took at least 1 dose of study medication, and contributed sufficient data for calculation of this outcome Measure.

measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS) was performed and was based on data from all subjects who were randomized, took at least 1 dose of study medication, and contributed sufficient data for calculation of this outcome Measure.

outcome.title: GCSQ Score, 5 Minutes Post-dose
outcome.description: Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. The GCSQ consisted of two questions that required the patient to rate shortness of breath and feelings of chest tightness. The patients recorded their response on a five-point Likert-type scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely), the total score being calculated as the average score of the two questions.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) was performed and was based on data from all subjects who were randomized, took at least 1 dose of study medication, and contributed sufficient data for calculation of this outcome Measure.

group.description: Spiriva® (tiotropium) 18 mcg, one inhalation once daily and placebo Turbuhaler one inhalation once daily

measure.title: GCSQ Score, 5 Minutes Post-dose
measure.description: Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. The GCSQ consisted of two questions that required the patient to rate shortness of breath and feelings of chest tightness. The patients recorded their response on a five-point Likert-type scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely), the total score being calculated as the average score of the two questions.

group.title: Symbicort+Tiotropium
group.description: Symbicort Turbuhaler® (budesonide/formoterol) 320/9 mcg, one inhalation twice daily and Spiriva® (tiotropium) 18 mcg, one inhalation once daily

group.title: Placebo+Tiotropium
group.description: Spiriva® (tiotropium) 18 mcg, one inhalation once daily and placebo Turbuhaler one inhalation once daily

measure.title: GCSQ Score, 15 Minutes Post-dose
measure.description: Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. The GCSQ consisted of two questions that required the patient to rate shortness of breath and feelings of chest tightness. The patients recorded their response on a five-point Likert-type scale ranging from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely), the total score being calculated as the average score of the two questions.

outcome.title: Capacity of Day Living in the Morning (CDLM) Score
outcome.description: Daily diary record. Change in average values from run-in to the full treatment period. The CDLM questionnaire is as a questionnaire to report on patient’s ability to carry out each of six different morning activities (score ranging from 0 “not performed” to 1”performed”) and rank the difficulty of performing each of those activities (score ranging from 0 “so difficult that the activity could not be carried out by the patient on their own” to 5 “activity was not at all difficult to carry out”. Total score for each morning activity range from 0-6. Total score for whole CDLM questionnaire range from 0-36.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) was performed and was based on data from all subjects who were randomized, took at least 1 dose of study medication, and contributed sufficient data for calculation of this outcome Measure.

Total score for each morning activity range from 0-6. Total score for whole CDLM questionnaire range from 0-36.

event.sub_title: Infective Exacerbation of Chronic Obstructive Airways Disease

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Prior to any publication or disclosure, the PI provides AstraZeneca with preliminary data and drafts and with the proposed final manuscript. AstraZeneca shall have a period of 30 days from receipt of the proposed final manuscript to review it and may within such time frame require that submission for publication or disclosure be delayed.
